climbs.name: Unnamed
climbs.fa: Jerry, Sigrid & Lynnea Anderson, Csuri Odrey (2005)

content.description: This is the first route you come to from the trail, it starts at the toe of the lower buttress. A 5.8 crux comes early on then 5.easy climbing to the anchor. Decent warm-up.
content.protection: bolts, optional knob sling and small cam for the run-out to the anchor

content.description: Straight up the face of the lower buttress, a cool lie-back move on a flake leads to easier climbing above. The spacing on teh bolts is a bit sporty compared to other routes on the wall.
content.protection: bolts, optional know slings for the top
content.location: Next route over from the toe of the buttress, first of several bolted routes on the main face f the upper buttress

content.description: Tricky slab leads to a highly enjoyable face climbing above.
content.protection: Bolts, #2 cam and optional knob sling small gear for the 5.easy run-out at the top
content.location: 1st route on the 2nd higher buttress. The route starts in the chasm/cave in between the two buttress.

content.description: Climb up the face with just enough small holds where you want them. Climb past a short arete with a mantle-like move at the top to gain easier climbing to the anchors. Very well protected. No rap rings on the anchors. Can down climb the 3rd class gully to the left or rap off the anchors of Unnamed 5.8 to the right.
content.protection: 10 bolts. Bolted anchor with no rap rings.
content.location: A short distance up the left (SW) side of the lower buttress. Look for the abundant well spaced bolts and the short arete at the top. Left of Scrunch Power.

content.description: Climb up the steep golden face. The highlight is some hand-foot matching. The route is only a TR problem.
content.location: Next to the easy crack, have fun.

content.description: Easy climbing on the toe of the upper buttress leads to a short bolts protected crux. Easier climbing to the anchors
content.protection: Mostly bolts #2 and #3 BD cam will protect short crack sections between the bolts. Could be led on botls alone if confident at the grade
content.location: Located on the upper buttress. Starts on left side of the butress and the obvious toe
This is located on the NW face of the formation. Follow the obvious short off-width to the bolt anchor above.

content.description: Start in a corner ramp, the rock is slicker than it looks! Make it to the jug, pull the mini-lip and cruise up the slab to the anchor!
content.protection: Bolts. Optional knob slings for the run-out to the anchor
content.location: To the left of the 5.11a on the lower buttress. The route starts in a obvious ramp/corner system.

content.description: Traversing route that heads out on small knobs. Well protected.
content.location: Right-most route on the upper buttress, bolt line that heads furthest right.

content.description: Start in the easy offwidth, bust left onto the bolted face above.
content.protection: 1 5" piece then the rest is bolts. Or skip the pro and go straight to the bolts
content.location: On the the NW face of the formation, next to the obvious offwidth climb

content.description: An enjoyable splitter crack/stem problem. If only it were longer.
content.location: This is located on the West face of the formation. Scramble up to a ledge to climb that. Easy to TR.

content.description: Traversing, well protected slab leads to a short steep section. Height dependent crux.
content.location: This is traversing route that moves up the slab on the lower buttress and finishes out right on a big ledge.

climbs.name: Albert's route
climbs.fa: Albert Nugue TR 2007, FFA Jerry, Sigrid & Lynnea Anderson 5/08,

content.description: A very difficult slab move to easier climbing above. Crux comes right after the first bolt.
content.protection: Bolts. Optional knob slings for the run-out at the top
content.location: On the lower buttress. The route is located to the left of the unamed 5.8 route you arrive at first from the approach trail

content.description: Upper route on right side wall
